name: Nehemiah
description: Cupbearer to Persian king who returned to rebuild Jerusalem's walls. Completed the impossible in 52 days while enemies mocked. Builder, leader, and defender who refused to come down from his great work.

building-wall.name: Building the Wall
building-wall.description: Hands on stones, actively rebuilding Jerusalem
building-wall.prompt: actively placing stones on wall under construction - sleeves rolled up, hands on masonry, leading by example, Jerusalem's walls rising around him, the builder who worked alongside his people

sword-and-trowel.name: Sword and Trowel
sword-and-trowel.description: Building with weapon ready - worker and warrior
sword-and-trowel.prompt: working on wall with sword strapped to side - trowel in one hand, weapon ready, building while prepared to defend, the dual role of builder and warrior under threat

rallying-workers.name: Rallying the People
rallying-workers.prompt: standing before workers with arm raised rallying them - passionate speech, inspiring the discouraged, the leader who turned despair into action with words

refusing-to-descend.name: Cannot Come Down
refusing-to-descend.description: Refusing to be distracted from the great work
refusing-to-descend.prompt: standing firm on wall looking down at messengers below - hand raised in refusal, face showing absolute focus, refusing to be pulled away from the work, enemies' tricks rejected

wall-complete.name: Wall Finished
wall-complete.prompt: standing before completed wall with quiet triumph - hand touching finished stonework, the impossible accomplished in 52 days, enemies silenced, Jerusalem restored

surveying-ruins.name: Surveying the Ruins
surveying-ruins.description: Night inspection of Jerusalem's broken walls
surveying-ruins.prompt: riding through ruins at night examining broken walls - torch or moonlight revealing destruction, the leader assessing what must be done, grief turning to determination
